message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.ET

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a nanonetworking protocol for controlling the behavior of metasurfaces, which involves communication between nano-nodes embedded in the material. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper uses the Lyapunov drift minimization approach to derive the proposed protocol, which is a technique commonly used in information theory.
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper deals with software-defined metamaterials, which are materials that can change their electromagnetic behavior on demand. This falls under the scope of multimedia, which includes the processing and transmission of information in various forms.
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a protocol for controlling the behavior of metasurfaces, which can be seen as a system that needs to be controlled. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
5. cs.ET (Emerging Technologies) - The paper deals with a recently proposed class of materials, called software-defined metamaterials, which can be seen as an emerging technology. This falls under the scope of emerging technologies.
